BR_text.BRsummary: Display error when using streamlit.write() on a numpy array with exponential notation
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
 
 When setting up a numpy array with small exponentials and displaying it with the streamlit.write() method, only NaN values are displayed.
 <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce:</denchmark-h>
 
 Create a python file with the following code and run it with streamlit run:
 import numpy as np
 import streamlit as st
 
 a = np.array([4.2e-09, 4.2657457627118644e-09])
 for b in a:
     st.write(b)
 st.write(a)
 <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 The values displayed when calling write on the entire array should be the same as when calling write on each float separately.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 The call of write with each float separately works fine, the call of write on the entire array produces NaNs, same for pandas dataframes, also for the table or dataframe methods of streamlit.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
 
 Not sure
 <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Streamlit version: 0.50.2
 Python version: 3.7.3
 Using conda 4.7.12 and pip 19.1.1
 OS version: Ubuntu 18.04.1
 Browser version: Firefox 70.0.1
